firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.users¶

class firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.users.Permission(config: dict, app: App)¶

Bases: BaseRecord

A Permission.

class firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.users.User(config: dict, app: App)¶

Bases: Record

Represents a User in Firemon

Parameters:

  • config (dict) – dictionary of things values from json

  • app (obj) – App()

Examples

Unlock and Enable all users

>>> for user in fm.sm.users.all():
...   user.enabled = True
...   user.locked = False
...   user.save()
set_password(password: str) → bool | dict | str | bytes¶

Set user password

Parameters:

password (str) – password

Returns:

bool

ep_name = 'user'¶
get(*args, **kwargs) → User | None¶

Get single User

Parameters:

  • *args (int/str) – (optional) id or name to retrieve.

  • **kwargs (str) – (optional) see filter() for available filters

Examples

Get by ID

>>> fm.sm.devices.get(1)
<User(firemon)>

>>> fm.sm.devices.get("workflow")
<User(workflow)>
template() → dict¶

dictionary of data to pass to create

dict

exception firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.users.UsersError¶

Bases: SecurityManagerError

FireMon-API is a Python web wrapper for the FireMon SIP (Security Mangager, etc...) APIs. The intent is make something that is useful for quick and easy development against FireMon products.
